p: Kawasaki Disease (KD) is a worldwide illness, with varying incidence rates that primarily reflect the racial composition of the populations of various countries. The highest incidence of KD is in Japan, and this has steadily increased with an annual rate of 308.0 per 100,000 children under 5 years reported in 2014 ( 1). In Japan one in 65 children develops KD by age 5 years. The second highest reported rate was 199.7 per 100,000 < 5 years old in 2014 in South Korea ( 2), while Taiwan has the third highest rate, 82.8 per 100,000 < 5 years old in 2010 ( 3).
